newsitem.title: JAPAN: Dollar leaps vs mark on stop-loss dollar buying.
newsitem.headline: Dollar leaps vs mark on stop-loss dollar buying.

text.p: 0108 GMT-- *Dollar continued to rise against mark in mid-morning Tokyo, with stop-loss dollar buying triggered at several points such as 1.7110 and 1.7130 marks.
*Further stop-loss buying expected at 1.7185 marks, said a German bank dealer in Tokyo. Clear rise above 1.7120 marks opens way for major dollar/mark rally, he added.

*Win by France's Socialist-led opposition in Sunday's election prompted dollar purchases vs European units due to growing fears of soft euro. Trend likely to continue for while, dealers in Tokyo said.
*"Both domestic and overseas operators, including speculators, flocked to sell marks in morning trade after the results of the French election," said the German bank dealer.

*"The dollar's rise above 1.7185 marks may be overdone in the near term, although it could strengthen over the long term," he added. Sporadic profit-taking emerged after dollar rose as high as around 1.7165 marks, dealers said.
*Mark fell against dollar and yen in early Tokyo as traders began selling marks in reaction to triumph by France's Socialist-led opposition in Sunday's second-round election.
*Although victory by left-wing parties mostly anticipated, image of weak euro caused wave of mark sales, dealers said.
*Dollar/yen stuck near 116 yen, top-heavy above 116.50 yen with steady exporter offers.
*A trust bank dealer said mark/yen could be technically supported near 67.75 yen, but dip towards 67.50 yen possible if it clearly breaks through that point.
*Franc had lost ground through Sunday evening after voting ended at 1800 GMT and projections showed a left-wing win, dipping to 3.3840/45 per mark at 2305 GMT from 3.3816 late on Friday.
